author: bergmeister
body:
The current roadmap [here](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/roadmap.md) states that .Net Core 2.2 should go RTM in Q4 2018 but .Net Core 3.0 only in Q1 2019.
There are already official previews of 2.2 available [here](https://www.microsoft.com/net/download/dotnet-core/2.2) but 3.0 offers only daily bleeding edge builds.

What are the plans on using a newer version of .Net Core and which version will be the next targeted update?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I don't know MSFT team plans but in terms of timelines, we cannot have 6.2.0 on .Net Core 3.0 - only on 2.2.
We could use `publicsign`  and `tired compilation`.
We investigated the tired compilation in #7731 and found it useful for PowerShell performance.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov is correct that we can't ship a 6.2 on an unsupported 3.0 release.  Based on .NET Core's current roadmap, 6.2 will likely be based on 2.2 and 6.3 would be on 3.0.

title: Question: .Net Core Roadmap: 2.2 vs 3.0
